intro: Qaisera carinata, commonly known as the spiked qaisera, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, ridged stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight serration along the edges. Qaisera carinata is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
